pullRequest.body:
Add the lemma that says that if `f` is measurable, then `f+g` is measurable iff `g` is measurable. Then add the same but with `g+f`, and the same lemmas about AEMeasurable, StronglyMeasurable and AEStronglyMeasurable.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Can you comment on why you're tagging these lemmas with `measurability`? I don't claim any expertise in how the `measurability` tactic works, but these lemmas don't seem (to my inexpert eye) as if they would be helpful for that tactic, given that it already has `Measurable.mul` etc at its disposal.

> Can you comment on why you're tagging these lemmas with `measurability`? I don't claim any expertise in how the `measurability` tactic works, but these lemmas don't seem (to my inexpert eye) as if they would be helpful for that tactic, given that it already has `Measurable.mul` etc at its disposal.

Thank you for your feedback.
I don't know how `measurability` works internally, I added the tag hoping that in this way `measurability` would be able to automatically solve situations like the following one:

```
example [CommGroup M] [MeasurableMulâ‚‚ M] [MeasurableInv M] (hf : Measurable f) (hfg : Measurable (f * g)) :
    Measurable g := by
  -- measurability -- doesn't work
  sorry
```

But it seems that even with the tag it doesn't manage to prove this. So I guess that I could remove them, if you agree.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9269071004/job/25499096696)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9269071004/job/25499095840)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9269071004/job/25499096440)
Can you please remove the measurability attributes? Other than that, it looks good to me.
Can you please remove the measurability attributes? Other than that, it looks good to me.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add mul_iff right and mul_iff_left for (AE)(Strongly)Measurable
